page.description: Updates a record in a table. Data is CRLF delimited list. Style 1 - data is fieldname=fieldvalue pairs, Style 2 data is just fieldvalues in same order as fieldnames
page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = record_update(C tablename ,C filter ,C data [,N style ])
page.returns: Result_Flag (L) = .T. = the record was modified. .F. = the record was not modified.

argument.name: filter
argument.description: A filter expression that evaluates to a logical value and selects a record from the table.

argument.name: data
argument.description: A CR-LF delimited list of the field values to write into the selected record. The data can be presented in two different formats as defined by the Style argument.

argument.name: style
argument.description: Default = 1. An optional style selector. See explanation below for more information.

page.discussion: RECORD_UPDATE() modifies a record in table Table_Name. The record is selected using Record_Filter and updated with the field values specified by Data_List.Note : If more than one record matches the filter, the function only modifies the first record found in record number order.

section.title: Example
section.description: The following example changes the values of the firstname and lastname fields in the first record of the salespeople table.
section.example: dim str as C str = <<%dat% firstname = george lastname = white %dat% ? record_update("salespeople", ".t.", str) = .T.

section.title: Setting the Style
section.description: The Style selector defines the format of the data. There are two options available:

case.title: Style = 1
case.description: The default style used, data is listed using a CR-LF delimited list of *[xb:<field_name> = <value>]* pairs. For example:
case.example: Fieldname1 = Value1 Fieldname2 = Value2 FieldnameN = ValueN
